meanings.definition: Having or showing a moderate or humble estimate of one's merits, importance, etc.; free from vanity, egotism, boastfulness, or great pretensions.
meanings.sent1: She wore a modest dress to the party, not wanting to draw too much attention.
meanings.sent2: The modest house on the corner had a small garden in front.
meanings.sent3: His modest request for a second piece of cake was met with laughter from the guests.
meanings.sent4: The modest sun peeked through the clouds, casting a gentle glow over the meadow.
meanings.sent5: In the modest light of dawn, the city slowly woke up to a new day.

meanings.definition: Limited or moderate in amount, extent, etc.
meanings.sent1: She had a modest collection of stamps from different countries.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant offered a modest selection of desserts on their menu.
meanings.sent3: His modest savings allowed him to take a short vacation to the beach.
meanings.sent4: The modest rainfall was just enough to water the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The modest crowd gathered in the park for the outdoor concert.

meanings.definition: Not extreme in conduct, opinion, amount, etc.
meanings.sent1: Her modest reaction to the news surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their victory in a modest manner, without any grand gestures.
meanings.sent3: His modest score on the test was still higher than the class average.
meanings.sent4: The modest increase in temperature made the day more comfortable for outdoor activities.
meanings.sent5: The modest applause at the end of the performance reflected the audience's appreciation.
